intro: Erigone govenica, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth and small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. Erigone govenica thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
